title: For Sale:  M24 A2 Clone         Army M24 A2 Remington Sniper Precision Rifle
postcontent: This is an M-24 A2 clone. The action is a Remington 700 Short action(for stiffness) and not a long action like the true M24. It does have and M-24 stamp on the left side of the receiver. The trigger is nice and crisp with no travel and I believe it to be around 2/2.5 lbs of pull. There is a badger ordnance Bolt handle attached to the bolt. A 20 moa stainless steel Leupold pica tinny rail sits on top along with a Nightforce 3.5-15 X 50mm Scope and Burris Tactical rings. The scope is MOA Adjustments with a Mil reticle. Very clear and precise. The stock is an HS Precision M24 A2 stock with an adjustable length of pull and free floats the barrel. The barrel is made by Mike Rock at Rock Creek barrels and is a 1 in 11.25 (5R) Barrel. ITs a very thick barrel with the muzzle being .920 to .930 of a inch

I am selling a like-new Burris XTR w/Fast Fire III setup. The XTR (Extreme Tactical Rifle scope) is a 1-4x24 second focal plane optic with BDCs for 5.56. The Fast Fire III is Burris's RMR red dot, which sits on top of the XTR or can be mounted directly to a rifle, pistol, or shotgun. This is a great optic setup for someone looking to maximize range of a rifle while maintaining close proximity effectiveness. 

Included with this setup is both optics and the mounts, as well as stand-alone scope rings, (if you choose not to use the Fast Fire III on the same weapon), scope cover and cleaning cloth, adjustment screwdriver and all Burris documentation/user manuals.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1897 Winchester 12 gauge take-down pump Marysville
location: Arlington, Marysville, Snohomish, Monroe, Washington, United States
postcontent:
Title says what it is. Selling/trading because I've decided not to pursue CAS and this was to be my shotgun. I have not fired this gun but it was looked at by a gunsmith and pronounced "good to shoot." I don't remember the exact year but the serial number put the gun at over 100 years old. I actually got it from someone who believed  he was the grandson of the original owner. (True or not I donno, who knows what happened 100 years ago. I don't think my own grandfather would have been born long enough ago to have been the original owner and I think I was older than he was. But that is what he thought anyway.) 

Face to face, meet in Snohomish County. If your not legal to own in WA don't bother me. I will want to see at the bare minimum proof that you are a WA resident (any of the standard "proofs" will work) and if age is a question, proof of age. (If you are 50 it is pretty unlikely I'm gonna think you are 15.) Reply to the posting or feel free to text, Four 2 Five - 971 - Four Seven 20. I'm serious about being legal, your girlfriend lives in Bellingham but you live in Oregon does not make you a Washington resident and trying to make that argument makes you a PITA.

title: For Sale:  BUFFALO BORE AMMO - .45 AUTO RIM STANDARD PRESSURE AMMO - 255 GR. H.C. F.N. (850 FPS/ M.E. 409 FT. LBS) - 20 ROUND BOX
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=72

You've been asking for a couple heavy 45 AUTO RIM standard pressure loads, so by popular demand, here they are. Both of these loads utilize high quality Starline brass. We've also incorporated flash suppressed powder so you can shoot in the dark without blinding yourself and this is important because over 95% of all civilian shootings in the USA occur in low light when the criminal element is at work. Both of these loads are the ballistic equivalent of +P 45 ACP loads, yet they operate at standard 45 ACP pressures. These loads are safe to use in ANY 45 ACP revolver that is in normal operating condition, including ANY model 1917 Colt or S&W revolver.

Check out the below velocities fired from personal real world revolvers, NOT test barrels. You'll notice that the new S&W 4 inch MT Gun gives velocities almost as fast as the older S&W revolvers with 5.5 inch and 6.5 inch barrels. This is not a typo. It simply shows that the new S&W revolvers are made to much tighter tolerances than the older S&W revolvers and therefore give higher velocities per inch of barrel.

Item # 31A - 255gr. hard cast flat nose bullet
S&W Mountain Gun, 4 inch bbl = 869 FPS
S&W Model 325 (scandium) 2.5 inch bbl = 795 FPS
S&W Model 1917 (1937 production) 5.5 inch bbl = 880 FPS
S&W 1955 Target (25-2) 6.5 inch bbl = 875 FPS

Item # 31A was designed for deep penetration with no bullet expansion. It will shoot through stick frame and dry wall construction walls and through both doors on a 2003 Dodge Ram or through a black bears skull, etc. It was designed for, among other things, outdoor use including black bear protection. Expect around 27 inches of penetration through live flesh and bone.

title: For Sale:  AR-15 Jigless 80% Lower Receiver - Black
postcontent:
Looking for a winter project? Finishing an 80% lower is an easy, affordable and satisfying way to build your own custom AR-15.
These are so easy to finish you can damn-near do it entirely with a Dremel but a drill press is recommended. Use a #115 Dremel bit or 3/8" or smaller end mill bit to route out the fire control pocket, then drill the hammer/trigger pin holes, the selector hole and the trigger hole to finish your receiver. Instructions are available online along with numerous youtube videos for additional support, links can be provided if necessary. If you go slow and steady it's almost impossible to not finish with a working receiver.


Jigless 80% Lower Receiver - Black

Here it is - a JIGLESS 80 percent AR receiver. Machining with a Jig will soon be a glimpse of the past. We bring you an 80 percent lower that can be machined without a jig! Correct - you do not need a Jig to complete this AR Lower Receiver! This 80% lower receiver is made with a Kevlar reinforced polymer. No Jig is required to machine out. Simply get rid of all the white.
Although this product can be completed without a jig, it is still recommended that a jig be used especially for the inexperienced builder. We will NOT warranty a product for Trigger Holes / Safety Selector / Trigger pocket being miss-drilled by the customer. Thank you

$99 each

title: For Sale:  Arms Corp FSR 38 FireStorm 38 Special
postcontent:
SALE PENDING


I am selling my Wifes' FireStorm  38 Special. She asked for a revolver, she got a revolver, and realized they're bigger than she wated.  She wants something much smaller.  Only been fired once, about 50 rounds put through it.  It being a revolver, it is extremely reliable. I will be including a box of 25 hollow-points, and a  50 ct box of standard ball ammo. I am the original owner of this gun. As you can see in the photos this is a "hammerless" model (IE: No grip to pull the hammer back with your thumb).  The hammer can still be locked back by hand by partially pulling the trigger grabbing the hammer with your thumb.  (Do this at your own risk, don't be an idiot and hurt yourself, or God-forbid, someone else.  If you're not confident in your abilities to do so, don't do it. I'm not responsible for your actions you decided to take upon yourself to do "Because you saw it on the internet.") Disclaimer stated, it has an extremely light trigger pull when the hammer is pulled back.  It's awesome.  

There is good documentation online on accessories for these revolvers. Usually found under the Bersa name.  Hand grips are widely available. If we were going to keep it, that would be something I purchased. But the Mrs wants something smaller. (Go figure...)

Arms Corp built this design for Bersa for many years if I remember correctly, and stopped building under the Bersa name a few years ago. 


Included but not pictured, is the original case, first shot brass, and all paperwork associated with the gun from the MFR.


If you are interested in purchasing, You can email me at the included email address, and we can make arrangements to meet. I will be documenting the sale on paper, and making a photocopy of your valid drivers license to be printed up and stored with my copy of the paperwork. We will each have a copy of the paperwork. I'm not interested in finding your house or where you live, stealing your identity, etc. I just want to keep myself clear if something happens involving the firearm. It will stay locked up in my safe for eternity.

title: For Sale:  GG&G aimpoint cantilever mount, QD
postcontent:
Like new no scratches retails for $199, will ship for $130 or $120 face to face

Product description
Important Aimpoint CompM2, ML2 and M3 Mounting Considerations:
Do to the Accucam mounting mechanism being located on the non-ejection port side of most weapons, the battery/brightness control mechanism of the Aimpoint will be located at the 10:00 o'clock position as shown in the above image (non-ejection port side), instead of the 2:00 o'clock position (ejection port side). This allows a right handed shooter to easily operate the Accucam QD mechanism and the brightness control knob with the off hand instead of the fire control hand. The windage and elevation adjustments are also rotated.

Important Aimpoint CompM3 Rubber Cover Consideration: 
If you intend to use the rubber cover included with your Aimpoint CompM3, it will need to be modified to fit with the Accucam QD Aimpoint Cantilever Mount. 

Product Description:
Many of you have asked us to develop a quick detach system for our combat tested Aimpoint Cantilever Ring. With the development of our Accucam Quick Detach Locking Lever System we are now able to fill those requests. The Accucam Quick Detach Aimpoint Cantilever Ring has the same robust features as our original Aimpoint Cantilever Ring. The body is manufactured from solid billet 6061 T6 aluminum and six cap screws firmly hold the Aimpoint in place. Also, a spare battery is kept handy in an insulatd capped waterproof compartment. The height of the Aimpoint QD Cantilever Ring allows for "True Absolute Co-Witnessing" when using back up iron sights.
The Accucam QD Locking Lever System provides you with a solid method to quickly install or remove your Aimpoint mount from the weapon system. The Aimpoint can quickly be installed on a dovetail rail in seconds by rotating the Accucam Cam Lever to the locked position. It can then be quickly removed by rotating the Accucam Cam Lever to the unlocked position. It is fully adjustable to fit worn or out of spec MIL-STD-1913 dovetails. Not recommended for .50 BMG or lightweight machine guns.
In tests, the Accucam Locking Lever System has shown to be repeatable to 1/2 MOA. The unique finger loop design is easily operated, even with a gloved hand and the rounded design is ergonomic and virtually snag-proof. The Accucam mechanism is manufactured from solid billet 4140 steel and manganese phosphated black to mil-spec.

I'm looking for full size Kimber 1911 double stack 45 acp in excellent condition (composite lower).  I'd prefer a CUSTOM but will consider all in excellent condition.  Will also consider purchasing just the lower if it is in excellent condition and build the rest of the gun myself.

You might be wondering why I'm advertising looking for a Kimber 1911 double stack when there are at least 2 on Armslist?  Well, these individuals are apparently afraid of technology and the concept of selling a firearm through FFL and PayPal.  If you can setup an Armslist account and post an ad, you can setup a PayPal account and REQUEST A PAYMENT.  It is so easy that even a child could do it... and it protects both you (the seller) and me (the buyer).

This is how it would work if we agree on a sale:
1) You: make a REQUEST FOR PAYMENT on PayPal to me (include details of the gun, serial number, and the FFL you plan to ship from).
2) I call the your FFL to verify them and to provide my FFL information.
3) You: go to the your FFL and I call them to verify your gun and then I submit payment on PayPal.
4) You: verify payment received and I setup shipping with your FFL and MY gun.  You get to keep a copy of receipt for shipping from FFL (your proof you left gun with FFL).
5) You enjoy your $, I enjoy my gun.

PayPal wouldn't stay in business or serve any purpose unless they protected both buyer and seller.  Don't be afraid... not all technology is bad.

Greg

PS - no "used car salesman" tactics.  Tell me what you want for the gun and if it's fair, I'll accept or I'll offer a very fair price.

postcontent: Make - Bushmaster Model - M17-S, 'Bullpup' configuration Gen. 2 Operation - Semi-Automatic Rifle Caliber - .223 Rem/5.56 NATO Condition - Factory new condition without box Barrel - 21.5", chrome-moly vanadium steel; chrome-lined chamber and bore. Extras - Comes with a sling, two 30-round mags and a rail on top of the carry handle for mounting optics. This rifle comes with back-up/iron sights. Please note that this rifle does NOT come with the red dot optics as pictured. The M17-S was a commercial bullpup rifle sold by the Bushmaster Firearms company of Windham, Maine, from 1994 to 2005. It was the first bullpup-configured rifle available commercially in the American market. Making use of a self-compensating gas system and a rotating bolt, the receiver is designed to be easily field stripped for cleaning, employing a captive-push-pin system to both open up the receiver and yet retain the push pins to prevent their loss in the field. The barrel length is 21.5 inches, with 6 lands/grooves, and incorporates a 1:9" twist. The butt-stock is integrated into the rear of the receiver in typical bullpup style, and the pistol grip is sharply angled to facilitate an ergonomic and comfortable grip whether shooting from the shoulder or off the shoulder. The carry handle also has a rail mounted to its top, allowing one to mount any type of standard optics. Magazine releases on each side of the rifle and a top-mounted charging handle allow for ambidextrous use, and it accepts any standard AR/M4/M16 magazine. Rare, and highly sought-after! title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer p556 pistol.
postcontent: I am selling my sig sauer P556 pistol. It is chambered in 5.56 NATO. This is a great compact rifle caliber pistol. The refined ak-47 style action is super reliable and super accurate even for its small size. It comes with a iTac defence 30 rd magazine and the nicer front forgrip that has the bottom rail for lights , lasers , etc. It also has a stainless gas system and aftermarket sling point on the rear of pistol. Also from factory it has standard front iron sight and the rear iron sight is nicely hidden and protected in the flat top rail. When needed it just flips up out of rail otherwise you can install your choice of sighting system. This pistol work perfect and is in like new condition and the only mark on it is where the brass hits the upper when the pistol is fired as designed. Mark is normal for this firearm and is minor due to this pistol being fired so little. I am asking $1395.00 obo I will consider any serious and reasonable offers. Also for an additional $250.00 I will include and have installed the ATF aproved shooters brace and tube and I will also throw in another 30 rd magazine. This modification was available when this model was produced but it is well worth the extra cost and makes this pistol one of the best little all round packages made and is perfect for home protection , hunting , prepping or just plain fun shooting with the family due to its low recoil and accuracy.

title: For Sale:  1930&1934 iz hex receiver mosin nagant w/ matching bayonets
postcontent:
Selling ONE of your choice, both are hexagonal izhevske in vg-ex condition and g-vg condition, respectively. Both with shiny, crisp, non-counter bored rifling.

1930 is arsenal refinished, and marked
1934 is not/unmarked (apparently, desireable), with some shellac rubbed off the front handguard--also in a tula stock (star stamped)

Both have all matching serial numbers and are imported by TGI (not century)
Make offer, as it is uncommon/rare to find one with the issued bayonet (as in even the serialnnunber on the bayonet matches)

*update. Have two friends interested--one, former Russian military (with no knowledge of the American market/desires) that simply wants a mosin. The other is a police recruit (with no knowledge of guns in general) that is interested because the history and other factors.

would prefer this go to some on that knows and appreciates all aspects of these rifles, again, they are: hex receivers, non-counter-bored barrels, all matching #s with matching bayonets, pre WW2 manufacture, and one that is not marked as refurbished

Prices for hex rifles are $160-180 from a dealer (cheapest), plus shipping and the transfer fee from a local shop or firearms dealer
these rifles have matching bayonets and are not-counterbored are the most notable things.

when imported bayonets at often mixed up and no one wants to dig through an actual pile of pointy metal things with numbers marked on them so they just grab one and sell it with the nearest rifle
bores are also occasionally counter-bored and affect accuracy

There are several other features that raise value that these rifles do not have, such as earlier WW1 years or being Dragoon or ex-Dragoon or sniper or ex-sniper, as well as various factories and other countries but these have their own qualities that raise value anyway

Stock has a few minor dings as might be expected, but looks very good. I've taken this one down and did a thorough cleaning. It is in great shape with a bright shiny bore.

1975 Winchester Model 94 30-30, blued w/wood stock, 20" barrel – Great working and Physical condition. Has some minor pitting, especially on one side of receiver, due to setting for many years. The rust and finish have been removed from the left side of the receiver where most of the pitting is located. Because of the difficulty in bluing this model, it will either need to be sent out for special processing, or one could go the paint route. Brownell's has a product called Paint & Bake that is said to look very nice and is very durable. It was owned by a very elderly man who has passed away. 1976 Glenfield Model 60 .22LR, tube fed semi-auto – Very good condition with the stock having some minor scratches and thinning of the finish in a couple places. Checkering is in great shape. Also has a Bushnell 4x Sportview 22 scope. Overall a good looking rifle. If the stock were just a little better, I'd grade it excellent.

title: For Sale:  Ruger “New” Vaquero in 45 Long Colt, 4 5/8” barrel, Case Hardened Finish - 2 Sets of Grips
location: South Mpls., Minneapolis / St. Paul, Minnesota
postcontent:
I took this as part of a motorcycle trade and would like to sell to purchase another motorcycle project for the winter. I’m more of a Glock guy but here is what I know about the Vaquero. 

Ruger “New” Vaquero in 45 Long Colt, 4 5/8” barrel, case hardened finish, Altamont pearl grips (factory black cheese grater grips included), 20 rounds of Corbon Hunter and 50 rounds of Herters lead round nose, original box, docs, and lock keys included.
The holster has been sold and is not included in the sale.

The original owner indicated that he had fired one box of ammo before placing this in his nightstand. Judging by its pristine condition I have no reason to doubt the statement. Also, this is appears to be a “New” model Vaquero as it begins with S/N 510 – xxxxxxxx  and was produced with the revised cylinder bore process as the Ruger “Billboard” safety warning is under the barrel as opposed to the side… more aesthetically appealing…that’s up to you.

Asking $600

Face-to-face cash sale in Minnesota only…I won’t ship. 
Thanks,
Tim
